intro: Strobilanthes andamanensis, commonly known as the Andaman starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its flowering period is brief, often occurring during the monsoon season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
